Column Comment.0: REPORTING HIERARCHY IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the reporting reserveshierarchy that has been defined.
Column Comment.1: COMPONENT IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the component associated with thishierarchy level.
Column Comment.2: RESERVE ENTITY HIERARCHY USE OBSERVATION NUMBER: Uniquecomponent added to the primary key that allows you to associate a hierarchy with aproduction entity or a reserves entity. For convenience, this table remains part of thereserves module, but users should be aware that it can be shared. More than oneentity may be associated with a specific level of the hierarchy.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: CONTRIBUTION PERCENT: the percent contribution for a substance that is used forreporting, such as 50% of NGL.
Column Comment.5: EFFECTIVE DATE: date on which the data in this row came into effect.
Column Comment.6: EXPIRY DATE: Date on which the data in this row of data was no longer in effect.
Column Comment.7: PRODUCTION ENTITY IDENTIFIER: An identifier that is unique within a specificproduction entity source and type.
Column Comment.8: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.9: PRODUCTION ENTITY SUBTYPE: the type of production entity may be equal to oneof the table names of the PDEN subtype tables, such as PDEN_WELL,PDEN_COUNTY or PDEN_FIELD. Validated by check constraint.
Column Comment.10: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.11: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.12: REPORT IND: A Y/N flag added to allow users to keep track of rows that should beincluded in reporting.
Column Comment.13: RESERVES ENTITY IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for a reserves entity. A reservesentity may be comprised of a single business object (such as a well) or a group ofbusiness objects (such as all the completions producing from a pool).
Column Comment.14: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.15: SUBSTANCE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a substance that can be describedeither chemically or in terms of composition. Elements, ions, isotopes, isomers,minerals, chemicals, solvents, production substances, hydrocarbons etc are all listed.Be advised that many applications and agencies may use the same term, but thedefinition and composition details may not be the same. Use the SUBSTANCE XREFtable to capture relationships between substances, such as similar substances.
Column Comment.16: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.17: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.18: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.19: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.20: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.21: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.22: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
